snippet: A lawsuit filed by the American Liberties Union of Illinois led to the new policy, one of several changes in the treatment of young offenders across the country.
abstract: American Civil Liberties Union of Illinois and Illinois Department of Juvenile Justice reach agreement that sharply limits practice of solitary confinement in juvenile correctional facilities; new policy requires that juvenile inmates spend at least eight hours a day outside their cells and that inmates in isolation continue to receive education and mental health services.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit filed by the American Liberties Union of Illinois led to the new policy, one of several changes in the treatment of young offenders across the country.

headline.main: Lawsuit Leads to New Limits on Solitary Confinement at Juvenile Prisons in Illinois
headline.print_headline: Lawsuit Leads to New Limits on Solitary Confinement at Juvenile Prisons in Illinois
